title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a java file is already opened in the workbench and another attempt is made to open the same file by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', nothing happens. There is no warning or error message displayed.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message displayed, informing the user that attempting to open a file that is already opened in an editor may cause the loss of unsaved changes. The message should prompt the user to close all file first before proceeding.
SR:
1. Close any opened java file. 
2. Go to the Java Perspective. 
3. Open a java file by double-clicking on it. 
4. Right-click on the same java file. 
5. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'. 

Expected: A warning or error message should be displayed, informing the user about the potential loss of unsaved changes and prompting them to close all files first.
